30366.name: Setup Zap
30366.description: (MVP) A blazing fast boilerplate generator for UI/UX Designers!

31252.name: Build Your First Plugin Tutorial
31252.description: Quickly create post components for a social media app, Petma. Choose between variants with different image placeholders and toggle between light or dark mode.

31247.name: Name Exporter
31247.description:
You can export(copy) your frame names which are in page roots.




Currently, this plugin is the simplest version.


I'm planning to add some features. If you have some idea or feature request, please contact me or leave comments :D

30528.name: Lingohub
30528.description:
All your texts in one place - Localize your Figma projects with Lingohub!

 

With Lingohub you localize your projects in no time! Whether they are web or mobile apps, games, or websites. We provide you with continuous translation management and a workflow that is smoothly integrated into your product development process.

 

With our Figma plugin you can easily push your text segments straight from Figma to Lingohub. After your translation has been completed, simply pull the texts directly from Lingohub. Just like that you can view your localized design in Figma.

 

Your translators have an added benefit too, as they are able to check the context of each text segment while translating. Screenshots of your design are automatically uploaded to Lingohub. The days of manually uploading screenshots are over.

 

What can you do with Lingohub?

  • Push and pull your text segments directly from Figma to Lingohub and vice-versa.
  • Different teams working together on localization.
  • Automate your software localization.
  • Translate with our powerful editor.
  • A translation tool you can depend on: term base, translation memory, quality checks, ...

 

For more information on how to use our Figma plugin, visit our Help Center article https://help.lingohub.com/en/.

 

To use the Figma plugin a paid account is required. We provide you with a 14-day free trial where all features are available for you to try. If you need help, feel free to contact our https://lingohub.com/support at any time. Or schedule a free https://lingohub.com/demo and learn all about Lingohub.

30705.name: Display for role
30705.description:
A plugin that allows managing roles by show-hide function


Prerequisites:

  • Add _roles page to your Figma file
  • Add a list of nodes with the names of your roles on _roles page
  • Plugin will automatically find this list and you can apply them to elements you want
  • Select the parent frame or group and then select the role and click show

31111.name: Create Story Page
31111.description: Create a page in Figma linked to a story card. Useful if you're managing your designs via a kanban board.

31505.name: Wordsvil
31505.description:
Wordsvil.com is made to help you and your team to organise, translate and update all text in your app and across different departments. Keep everyone on the same page.


  • Upload your text file (.csv, .json), or create it directly from your figma file
  • Invite team members to join you in Figma or on the webapp to work with you
  • Update and sync your files through the plugin or webapp, add new languages, ensure everyone is on the same page. 
  • Export for end-products in .csv and .json. (directly API coming soon) 


How it works: 

Wordsvil.com connects your Figma text objects with your apps text files. The figma object name will be synced with the text keys, to keep both text values the same.


  • Install the plugin, or log into the website and set up an account
  • Add a new project and use “from Figma page” if you want to start from your Figma files, or utilise the other option to start from scratch, from csv or json files. 
  • After the project is created, the plugin/webapp serves as the source of truth. 
  • Within the project, click on the menu and select Team to add collaborators to a project.


For csv follow this format. Example: 

key,notes,en,de 
welcome,,Welcome!,Willkommen!


For json follow this format. Example: 

{ "EN": { "welcome": "Welcome!",  “buy”: ”Buy now” },
  "DE": { "welcome": "Willkommen!", “buy”: ”Kauen”  }}


keywords/tags

copy, content, text, strings, writing, localization, language, translation, words, sync, translate

31385.name: Erase Frame&Group Number
31385.description: Make a Frame or Group like "Frame 3254" into "Frame" by removing the number in layer name.

31412.name: Parrot
31412.description:
Save and organize all of your views, for presentations and to organize your art boards.


Features:

  • Save views from different pages it will remember position and zoom level
  • Rename views whether it's a wireframe, a logo or a hi-res mockup
  • Presentation mode with next and prev controls
  • Hide saved views from the presentation will let you save but skip when presenting
  • Reorder list (coming soon)
  • Update view (coming soon)
  • Animated transitions (coming soon)

31367.name: Figma To Stitches
31367.description:
Unofficial Stitches Plugin that converts Figma styles to Stitches config


Forked from Figma to Tailwind plugin https://github.com/jan-dh/figma-tailwindcss

31454.name: Placeholdate
31454.description:
Quickly generate placeholder dates for your mockups, and format those dates however you want. This plugin relies heavily on the basic formatting features from day.js.


There are plenty of plugins out there that help populate your design with placeholder data. None of them provide flexibility with dates. This plugin was created to fill this gap.


At this time, Placeholdate does not support locales or advanced formatting. If this is a feature you need, please submit a GitHub Issue explaining your use case and the expected output.


Examples

If you are unfamiliar with day.js, you can try out these examples by pasting the format in the Date Format field in the plugin UI. These examples assume that the randomly selected date is set to "2022-04-25T22:16:35-06:00".


  • YYYY-MM-DD = 2022-04-25
  • MM/DD/YYYY = 04/25/2022
  • M/D/YY = 4/25/22
  • MMM D, YYYY = Apr 25, 2022
  • MMMM D, YYYY = April 25, 2022
  • dddd MMMM D, YYYY = Monday April 25, 2022
  • hh:mm a = 10:16 pm
  • hh:mm:ss A = 10:16:35 PM
  • [Meeting:] MMM D @ hh:mm A = Meeting: Apr 25 @ 10:16 PM


Many more combinations can be found on the day.js documentation.


Features

  • Select multiple text layers to generate multiple random dates.
  • Format dates according to your needs. The default is YYYY-MM-DD when the plugin is first opened.
  • Select a date range to start and end the random generation. The default is two years before and after the day the plugin is first opened.
  • Sort the generated dates in random order, ascending order, or descending order. NOTE: due to some Figma limitations, the order is set by when the text node was created. It will not sort on layer position or x/y position on the page.
  • Placeholdate will remember your last used format and options when you re-open the plugin.


Be Aware of the Following

  • Make sure to select text layers for this to work. Selecting a frame or group will not insert dates into child text layers.
  • Make sure that the starting date option is before the ending date. It will tell you if it is not the case.
  • Typing out the year in the start or end date field can accept more than 4 digits, but it will produce unexpected results. Just don't do it.

30823.name: Crylic
30823.description:
Integrate Crylic with Figma!


This plugin supports importing elements exported through Crylic.

Learn more at https://docs.crylic.io/workflows/exporting-to-figma

31404.name: specspec
31404.description: Make it easier for developers to implement a component with each variant being labeled. Often times a full matrix covering all the combinations is too much noise for a handoff. You can configure the plugin to generate a component specs with only the most essential variants.

31207.name: Bynder
31207.description:
Using the Bynder alongside Figma has never been easier. Connecting Bynder to Figma removes interruptions from your design workflow by enabling downloads from Bynder and providing access to your creative assets, stored in your asset bank, directly in Figma.


To enable access for your account, send us an email
